card.name: A Gift for Lords of Men
card.graphics: A Gift for Lords of Men.jpg
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Offering Attempt. Playable during CvCC before strikes are assigned. Transfer an item your Dragon-lord bears worth at least 2 mp to a non-Hobbit, non-avatar character in opponent’s company. Your Dragon-lord then makes an influence attempt against this character modified by adding the mp of the item, and by +2 if the Dragon-lord is a diplomat. If successful, target character joins the Dragon-lord’s company; discard all non-follower, non-item cards on the character. CvCC then procedes normally.

card.name: Aeglin
card.text: Unique. Playable at Cirith Helkaloke. Weapon: +3 to prowess (to a maximum of 9 or double the bearer’s base prowess). Counts as Sword of Gondolin for the purpose of Biter and Beater and Elven Blade. Elf warrior only: tap: take one Attuning the Blade from your discard pile to your hand.

card.name: Against the Eye
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase on your Dragon-lord’s current Shadow-hold [S], if you have at least 4P. Your Dragon-lord faces an attack: Troll – 1 strike at 15 (cannot be cancelled or redirected). Following the attack tap your Dragon-lord and the site or discard this card. All versions of this site become a Ruins & Lairs [R], this site is never discarded and never untaps for you.

card.name: Alliance among Neighbours
card.text: Playable if a Dragon-lord is in play. Allunique hero factions playable at sites in a region that contains a Dragon’s Den (and regions adjacent to these, if the Dragon-lord is not in a Dream mode) are worth 1 extra miscellaneous mp. Discard this card if no such faction is in play. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Ando-anca
card.text: Unique. Fire-dragon. May be played at Norr-dûm. 3 strikes. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows and Withered Heath; may also be played at sites in these regions.

card.name: Ando-anca Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Fire-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 4 strikes at 14/7. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Anduin Vales, Northern Rhovanion and Talath Uichel.

card.name: Ando-anca at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Ando-anca Ahunt is in play, Norr-dûm has an additional automatic-attack: Fire-dragon — 3 strikes at 17/8. In addition, all body checks for Dúnedain, Dwarves, Elves, Hobbits, Men, Orcs, Trolls and Umli resulting from unique Dragon attacks are modified by +1.

card.name: Ando-anca Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Ando-anca. Playable atNorr-dûm if the influence check is greater than 14. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+4) or a greater item (+7); if a manifestation of Itangast, Scatha or Smaug is in play (-3) All attacks by manifestations of Ando-anca against any of your companies are cancelled. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows and/or Withered Heath faces an attack: Cold-dragon — 3 strikes at 16/8 prowess/body.

card.name: Angurth
card.text: Unique. Cold-dragon. May be played at Long Peak. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. Angurth must always assign strikes to Dwarves first. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, and Withered Heath; may also be played at sites in these regions.

card.name: Angurth Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Cold-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 3 strikes at 14/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). Angurth must always assign strikes to Dwarves first. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion and Talath Oiohelka.

card.name: Angurth at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Angurth Ahunt is in play, Long Peak has an additional automatic-attack: Cold-dragon — 2 strikes at 17/8. In addition, each company at a non-Haven [H] site in Wilderland that did not attempt to move has its hazard limit increased by 1.

card.name: Angurth Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Angurth. Playable at Long Peak if the influence check is greater than 13. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+6), if a manifestation of Itangast or Throkmaw is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Angurth against any of your companies are cancelled. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, and/or Withered Heath faces an attack: Cold-dragon — 2 strikes at 16/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters). Angurth must always assign strikes to Dwarves first.

card.name: Appetite
card.text: Playable on a Dragon character not at a Dragon’s Den [K]. -3 to all his rolls to bring a character into play or to keep a character in play. Discard this card if such a roll fails. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon

card.name: Are There Dragons in This Land?
card.graphics: Are There Dragons in This Land.jpg
card.text: Playable on a Dragon character. If bearer is at or moving toa site that is not in a region containing a Dragon’s Lairor a Dragon’s Den [K] (or region adjacent to these), the following applies: tap: untap target Dragon or cancel an attack against his company.This card does not untap normally; tap bearer to untap this card. Discard this card to cancel any effect that would cancel CvCC with target Dragon’s company or an influence attempt by target Dragon. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Army of Bats
card.text: Flying. Playable at any tapped or untapped Shadow-hold [S] or Dark-hold [D] if the influence check is greater than 10. Standard Modifications: none. Once in play, the number required to influence this faction is 0. This faction is worth 1 mp if you have a unique Orc faction in play at the site where it was played. tap: during your movement/hazard phase to cancel the effects of The Sun Shone Fiercely or Glance of Arien for one of your moving companies this turn.Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Artful Words
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable on your Dragon-lord. +5 to his EI this turn, or +3 to one of his rolls for a flattery, riddling or offering attempt. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Aryen the Beastmaster
card.text: Unique. Agent. Grey Agent. +3 EI against animal factions. tap: cancel an Animal, Spider or Wolf attack againsthis company. Agent only: tap: allow any non-unique Animal, Spider or Wolf hazard creature to be played at his Border-hold [B] or Ruins & Lairs [R] site this turn. The creature must be keyable to a non-Coastal Sea region.

card.name: Attrition
card.text: Any defeated non-unique Gathered Bones inany players mp is worth no mp (overriding any resource effect). Additionally, all Dragon-lords and War- lords receive +2 P. Any defeated creature or Gathered Bone is not worth any mp for a Lord, Dragon-lord or War-lord with less than 6 P.

card.name: Aura of Fear
card.text: Dragon-magic. Playable on a Dragon-character's company during CvCC, before strikes are assigned. Make a roll for each character in opponent’s company. If the roll is higher than the character’s mind, he is tapped. Alternatively, playable on a magic using Dragon character facing a non-automatic- attack: the attack is cancelled.Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Awakened by his Malice
card.text: Sauron specific. You may bring one Balrog or Dragon character from your sideboard to your play deck when you play this card (reshuffle). These may only be brought into play at their home site: place this card with the character when he comes into play, it is worth 1 character mp if with a Balrog or Dragon character. A Balrog character costs 10 points of influence to control. Additionally, you may play Balrog specific resources only playable on a Balrog. Unless at a Darkhaven [K] your Balrog and Dragon characters must always form a single character company.

card.name: Axe-master
card.text: Warrior only. Playable on a Dwarf, Man, Orc or Sinda Elf bearing an axe. If bearer is chosen to face a strike from an attack with less strikes than the prowess bonus the axe gives against the attack, you may tap the axe and the character to face any number of strikes from the attack (in separate strike sequences). Each body check bearer makes is modified by an additional +1. Bearer makes a CC. This card gives 2 CP to an overt or minion character. Discard if bearer does not bear an axe.

card.name: Azog's Scimitar
card.text: Unique. Hoard Item. Weapon. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 9 (maximum of 11 against Dwarves). If borne by an Orc leader: +4 prowess against Dwarves, +2 EI against Orcs, 3 mp and 3 CP.

card.name: Bain
card.text: Unique. +1 prowess against Orcs, Dragons and Drakes. +1 EI against Men with a home site in Northern Rhovanion. +1 EI against Dwarves.

card.name: Bardings
card.text: Men. Each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). May be played keyed to Dorwinion, Grey Mountain Narrows, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, or Southern Rhovanion; and may also be played at non-Haven [H] sites in these regions. May also be played on Dale or Lake-town, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard Bardings at the end of the site phase). May not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with a home site in Dorwinion, Northern Rhovanion, or Southern Rhovanion.

attr.value: men. each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). may be played keyed to dorwinion, grey mountain narrows, iron hills, northern rhovanion, or southern rhovanion; and may also be played at non-haven [h] sites in these regions. may also be played on dale or lake-town, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard bardings at the end of the site phase). may not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with a home site in dorwinion, northern rhovanion, or southern rhovanion.

card.name: Battle of Five Armies
card.text: Unique. If played by a white player: playable if you have at least 1 unique Dwarf and Elf or Man faction in play. If played by a grey or black player: playable if you have at least 1 unique Orc and Wolf faction in play. Make a roll and designate 2 of your factions of the above named types for your alignment. If the result plus the total mp of both factions is: less than 9 — you must discard 1 of your designated factions; 11 or greater — your opponent must discard 1 of his unique factions in play of the above named types in the same territory as one of your factions. Remove this card from the game.

card.name: Beast-thrall
card.text: Unique. Jewel. Playable at Tower of the Wolf-friend. Sage only: tap sage and make a roll (+3 for magic users)when facing a Drake creature attack against his company. If the result plus his mind is greater than the attack’s prowess, place the creature with this item; it becomes an ally with a normal prowess -7 (cannot be influenced). Only one creature may be with this item at any time. During the untap phase, make the same roll as if the creature would attack (discard creature if the roll fails, or if you so choose). Values in parentheses apply when a creature is with this item.

card.name: Beaten into Submission
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on an attack by a Dragon hazard- manifestation against your Dragon-lord’s company. Tap your Dragon-lord. The attack is cancelled and the Dragon becomes an ally under the control of your Dragon-lord (place him with this card; ignore its card text). Its mind and mp are equal to half its normal mp (round down), prowess iz equal to its normal prowess minus 7 (normal body). The ally’s skills are warrior if played on a Fire-dragon; scout, if a Winged-dragon; ranger, if a Cold- or Ice- dragon; sage if a female Dragon; diplomat if a male Dragon. During your organization phase, opponent makes a roll (modified by +1 for each copy of this card on your Dragon-lord). If the result is greater than your Dragon-lord’s mind, the ally attacks him (ally’s current prowess plus dice roll; cannot be cancelled). After this attack, discard this card and the ally.

card.name: Belegennon
card.text: Unique. Hoard item. Armor. +1 to body (to a maximum of 9). A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to “restore” it. Once restored, Belegennon gives 4 mp and 3 CP. Warrior only (if restored): if bearer chooses not to tap against a strike he receives no prowess penalty.

card.name: Birth-spot
card.text: Playable on a Dragon character. He receives -3 body. When the Dragon-character does not tap to face a strike of an attack, he receives an additional -3 prowess penalty. If at his home site (or any Dragon’s Den [K]) during his organization phase, target Dragon may tap to discard this card. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Blade-master
card.text: Warrior only. Playable on Alatar or a Dúnadan, Elf, Man or Orc, if bearing a blade (e.g. a sword or a dagger). If bearer is chosen to face a strike from an attack, you may tap the blade: if the strike is defeated, any remaining strikes from this attack have its prowess/body reduced by the bonuses the blade gives against this attack. Otherwise discard the blade. Bearer makes a CC.This card gives 2 CP to an overt or minion character. Discard if bearer does not bear a blade.

card.name: Bone-hilted Broadsword
card.text: Hoard Item. Weapon. +2 to prowess to a maximum of 8 (+3 prowess to a maximum of 9 against Undead). Warrior only: +1 to body to a maximum of 8.

card.name: Bow-master
card.text: Playable on a character bearing and able to use a bow. If target character bears a bow he may tap for Wielded Twice or Raised Again as if he were a sage: shuffle Wielded Twice/ Raised Again in the play deck instead of discarding it (if you so choose).

card.name: Breed Desire
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Your GI is increased bya number based on the mp of your stored hoard items: 1 - 5 mp: +1; 7 - 11 mp: +3; 12 - 17 mp: +5; 18 or more mp +7.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

attr.value: Discard a non-battle-gear minor from the company to make Information playable. Tap the site during the organization phase to bring into play from hand or sideboard one Man character (even a minion character) with a home site in Wilderland. This character must be played under EI.
Tap the site during the organization phase to bring into play from hand or sideboard one Man character (even a hero character) with a home site in Wilderland. This character must be played under EI.

card.name: Calm Song
card.text: Magic. Spirit-magic. Song. Playable on a spirit-magic using character whose company faces a non- automatic, non-maia attack. The attack becomes detainment. Unless he is a Ringwraith, the character makes a CC modified by -3.

attr.value: Discard a Man character from hand during the site phase to heal (from wounded to untapped) a character at the site. Alternatively, discard Bain, Bard Bowman or Brand from your hand to heal (from wounded to untapped) all characters at the site. For either use tap the site.
Men — each character faces a strike with 7 prowess (detainment against covert company)
Discard a Man character from hand to heal (from wounded to untapped) a character in a covert company at the site. Tap the site if untapped.

card.name: Claws Sharpened
card.text: Playable on a Dragon. Each strike against the Dragon receives -1 prowess and -1 body (-2/-2 for a non-warrior Dragon). Discard this card after a strike against the Dragon fails. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon.

attr.value: Any non-unique, non-horse animal or wolf ally (normally playable at a site in the Northern Waste, Eriador or Wilderland) may be played at this site.

card.name: Consumed by Dragon-fire
card.text: Playable during the site phase on a company ata Dragon’s Lair bearing a unique hero item (except manifestations of The One Ring). Place the item with this card in your out of play pile. Until the end of the turn, any influence attempt against a Dragon faction at the site is modified by the number the removed item would give as if discarded for the attempt (treat a ring as a greater item). This card is worth 2 mp to a non-Dragon-lord player.

card.name: Corlagon
card.text: Unique. May be played at Cirith Helkaloke. Fire-dragon. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Angmar, Dragon Gap, Forochel, Gundabad and Misty Mountains - Northern Spur; may also be played at sites in these regions.

card.name: Corlagon Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Angmar, Dragon Gap, Forochel, Gundabad or Misty Mountains - Northern Spur immediately faces a Fire-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 3 strikes at 10/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Anduin Vales, Everdalf and Talath Uichel.

card.name: Corlagon at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Corlagon Ahunt is in play, Cirith Helkaloke has an additional automatic- attack: Fire-dragon — 2 strikes at 13/8. In addition, each rune item and each hoard minor item gives an additional CP.

card.name: Corlagon Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Corlagon. Playable at Cirith Helkaloke if the influence check is greater than 12. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+6); if a manifestation of Gondring or Scorba is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Corlagon against any of your companies are cancelled. Any company moving in Angmar, Dragon Gap, Forochel, Gundabad, and/or Misty Mountains - Northern Spur faces an attack: Fire-dragon — 2 strikes at 12/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters).

card.name: Cursed Treasure
card.text: Corruption. Playable on-guard at a Dragon’s Lair, if the corresponding Dragon is in active play but not at the site. Reveal and place this card on a character after playing a treasure item or an item stored at (any version of) the site; the character receives 4 CP and must immediately make a CC.

card.name: Daelomin the Ghost-Wing
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Daelomin. Female. Winged. Cold-dragon. May not move. Can use sorcery. +2 EI against (manifestations of) male characters. +4 to her rolls for flattery attempts. tap: during CvCC for an extra strike. tap: while at a Dragon’s Den, to cancel an effect that would raise the hazard limit of one of your companies.

attr.value: Dark Enchantment — each non-Wizard character in the company faces a strike with 8 prowess. His prowess against such a strike is equal to his mind.
Dark Enchantment — each character in the company faces a strike with 8 prowess. His prowess against such a strike is equal to his mind
opponent may play one Elven Wards from his discard pile or sideboard on a company moving to this site; Elven Wards affects any company moving to this site.

card.name: Deceived by His Voice
card.text: Flattery attempt. Playable on a character attempting to influence a faction. Tap the character and make a roll modified by +2 if the character is a diplomat; 1 diplomat only resource or resource that modifies flattery attempts may be played to modifiy this roll. If the result is greater than the listed values, the influence attempt against the faction is automatically successful without tapping the site, otherwise discard the faction. Against a Hobbit, Man, or Animal faction: 10; against a Dwarf, Wose, Orc or Troll faction: 11; against an Elf, Eagle, Dúnadan or Ent faction: 12.

attr.value: Orcs — 3 strikes with 7 prowess (detainment if Great Army of the North is in play)
Non-Nazgûl creatures played at this site attack normally, not as detainment. Grey Mountain Goblins faction is playable at this site.

card.name: Depredation of the Dragon
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Place this card on your Dragon-lord if heis in play. You may place any site your Dragon-lord’s company moves away fromunder this card instead of discarding it. Additionally, your Dragon-lord may tap to place a site in the same or an adjacentregion as his current site under this card; (versions of) such site may not be in active play, cannot be a Dragon’s Den [K], and one of the considered regions must contain a Dragon’s Den. Any version of a site under this card comes into play tapped; it may be untapped if a company at the site discards a Rebuild the Town, Hold Rebuild and Repaired or Drive Back the Shadow from hand or play during the site phase.

card.name: Destruction and Savagery
card.text: Dragon only. Playable on a Dragon character. Any non-Dragon faction brought into play by the Dragon may be placed with this card. If a faction is with this card, you may place it with the Dragon’s current Border-hold [B] or Shadow-hold [S]: it is worth 1 mp and all other player’s companies moving through the region containing the site face an attack for each faction attached (type same as faction). This attack has a number of strikes equal to the mp of the faction, and each strike has 8 prowess and 7 body. If the attack is defeated opponent receives the faction as kill mp.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Dire Negotiations
card.text: Offering attempt. Playable on a character whose company is facing a non-detainment attack of the type listed below. Character makes a roll modified by his unused EI, +2 if a diplomat, +3 for each non-unique animal ally (or character taken prisoner) that is eliminated from the company. If successful, the attack is cancelled and the hazard limit for the character’s company is decreased by 2. This influence check is successful if the result is greater than: 9 against a Dragon; 10 against Drakes, Giant, Orcs, or Trolls, 11 against Animals, Spawn, Undead or Wolves.

card.name: Dragon Hunters
card.text: Dwarves. 4 strikes. +4 prowess and -1 to target’s body against companies containing a Dragon or Drake. May only be played against an overt company. Dragon Hunters receives an additional +1 prowess for every Gathered Bones of Dwarf characters or Dwarf factions in opponent’s mp. May be played keyed to any region containing a Dragon’s lair or Dwarf-hold, and keyed on any non-Haven [H] site in those regions.

card.name: Dragon Mindbend
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a company. A character (even a non-Dwarf hero) with a mind up to 8 may be played with the company at a Dragon’s Den [K]; place this card with the character. -2 to his mind to a minimum of 4. No rolls are required for this character to stay in play. This card may also be played with a starting company in lieu of a minor item (reveal it when starting companies are determined as if it were a character). Alternatively, may also be played on a character in an opponent’s company at your Dragon-lord’s site. All influence attempts against this character are modified by +4; if the attempt is successfull, the characacter joins your company. Cannot be duplicated by a given Dragon-lord.

card.name: Dragon's Abode
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a Dragon’s Den [K]. The site is never discarded or returned to the location deck. You may discard this card during the organization phase. This card is worth 1 mp if played on a Dragon’s Den that is not your Dragon-lord’s home site. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Dragon's Breath
card.text: Playable on an attack by True Fire-drake, Winged Fire-drake, or on any Fire-dragon attack (must be played before strikes are assigned). Each character in the company being attacked must immediately face a strike equal to the attack’s prowess. Instead or using prowess against the strike, each character uses his body modified by +1 if he has a shield, by +1 if he has a helmet, and by +3 if he taps. The target attack which follows receives +1 body and -2 prowess. Cannot be duplicated on a given attack.

attr.value: Dragon-lord specific. Place this card on your Dragon's home site. This site is considered a Darkhaven [K] foryour companies. Nothing is considered playable here as written on the site card. All attacks against your companies at this site are cancelled, except CvCC involving a Dragon. Items stored at this site may be played by an opponent's company (as if in his hand); if any of your companies is present this may only be done after initiating CvCC. This card and the associated site always return to your location deck.

card.name: Dragon's Dream
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dream mode. Playable during the organization phase on your Dragon-lord at a Dragon’s Den [K]. Return this card to your hand: when you play another mode card, or during your organization phase if you so choose. +5 to your GI. Discard this card if your Dragon-lord moves.

card.name: Dragon's Nest
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a Dragon’s Den [K], if you have Mating Duel in play and you tap a female Dragon at the site. Any female Dragon at this site receives +2 prowess and +1 body. Discard this card if there is no female Dragon at the site. taRotate this card 90° during the site phase and make a body check for a female Dragon at the site to play one Dragon-egg with a character at the site; the item may also be taken from your sideboard or discard pile. When this card is rotated 360°, discard Mating Duel or discard this card.

card.name: Dragon's Sleep
card.text: Playable on a Dragon character moving awayfrom his home site or any Dragon’s Den [K]. Unless opponent discards Hunger or a manifestation of target Dragon from his hand, the Dragon must return to his site of origin.

card.name: Dragon's Vengeance
card.text: Playable on a company that has faced an attack froma unique Dragon manifestation this turn. You may play Foes Shall Fall or Bring Our Curses Home on the company as if played (normally) on the attack; it may also be played from the discard pile.

card.name: Dragon-egg
card.text: Treasure. Playable at a tapped or untapped site on which Dragon’s Nest is in play, if Dragon’s Nest has been rotated the same turn or after defeating a strike from a female Dragon in CvCC.

card.name: Dragon-hatchling
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable by your Dragon-lord at a tapped or untapped site containing a hoard, if you discard a Dragon-egg from the company. Each time Dragon-hatchling’s company defeats a creature you may place it with him (it is still considered Gathered Bones): for every two creatures placed with him, his prowess is increased by two and his mind by one.

card.name: Dragon-scales
card.text: Playable at a Dragon’s lair, if the associated Dragon has been defeated and you discard a Reforging or Dark-forges from the company. Armor. Helmet. +2 body (to a maximum of 10). Warrior only. +1 prowess. +3 to EI. Bearer cannot be targeted by dark/light enchantments. tap: cancel one attack from a Dragon or Drake hazard creature or automatic-attack. Dragon’s Curse and Dragon-sickness may be played on the bearer withour further requirements. Cannot be duplicated for a given Dragon.

card.name: Dragon-totem
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Leader only: +2 to bearer’s rolls to bring characters into play. All Nazgul, Orc and Troll attacks keyed to Dark-domains [d], Dark-holds [D] and Shadow-holds [S] against his company are not detainment. Cannot be duplicated on a given leader.

card.name: Dragonfire and Savage Swords
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase at a site which is a version of either a hero Haven [H] or an unprotected Wizard/Lord-haven, if you have at least 6 P. Tap the site if untapped. The company faces 2 attacks (attack type: same as automatic-attack, or Men for Wizardhaven) — 5 strikes with 9 prowess; 2 strikes with 12 prowess). After these attacks, tap your Dragon-lord or 2 characters in the company to place this card in your mp, or discard this card. All versions of the site become a Free-hold [F] if it was hero Haven [H] or a Ruins & Lairs [R] if it was a Lord-haven [H].Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Durlog
card.text: Unique. Dragon-lord specific. Leader. Discard on a body check result of 8. +3 EI against Orcs.

card.name: Eaten Half a Village
card.text: Dragon only. One roll by a Dragon character to bring a character into play (or keep him in play) is modified by +2 for every Gathered Bones in your mp.

card.name: Elfhewer
card.text: Unique. Weapon. Playable at Goblin-gate bya leader. May also be played at a tapped Goblin-gate, if Great Lord of Goblin-gate is in the company. This item is worth 3 mp if borne by an Orc leader. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 9 (+3 against Elves to a maximum of 10 and -1 to strike’s body).

card.name: Enchanted Stare
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable during the site phase on a character (even a non-Dwarf hero) in your Dragon-lord’s company, who was just brought into play by your Dragon-lord (or on a character in your starting company). Target character requires 3 points of influence to control and may only be controlled by your Dragon- lord or GI. No rolls are required to keep him in play. Alternatively may also be played on a hero character that was just influenced away from an opponent’s company by your Dragon-lord.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Enslaved Dwarves
card.text: Unique. Dragon-lord specific. Slave faction. Playable at a tapped or untapped site that is an Ancient Dwarf-ruin if the influence check is greater than 9. You may bring non-unique Dwarves into play at thesite where this faction is in play; your Dwarves may play hero ore events and items and these are worth full mp. Additionally, all Dwarf factions in play at sites in the same territory as this faction have their mp reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

card.name: Eodoric
card.text: Unique. +1 prowess against Animals and Wolves. tap: during your organization phase at a site in Northern Rhovanion to force an opponent to reveal 3 cards at random from his hand.

card.name: Fall on Them with Speed
card.text: Dragon only. Playable on an attack against a company moving with Flying movement and containing an unwounded Dragon. The number of strikes of the attack is reduced by 10 minus the prowess of the Dragon (to a minimum of one).

card.name: Faster Than the Winds
card.text: Playable during the organization phase on a company able to move with flying- movement. The company may move with flying movement to any site in the same or an adjacent territory as their current site (no region maximum). The hazard limit for this company is increased by 1 for every 4 regions the company moves through (round up). Remove this card from the game.

card.name: Fearsome Ally
card.text: Playable on one of your Dragon factions in active play. If one of your companies is at or moving to a site in the regions listed on the faction, you may discard a manifestation of target Dragon from hand to lower the combined prowess and/or body of an attack against this company by the mp of the faction. After the attack, the company must discard an item or face an attack by target Dragon (as listed on the faction; cannot be cancelled). Cannot be duplicated on a given faction.

card.name: Feud with the Dragon
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on an item in your hoard witha race specific bonus. Keep this card with the item. You maynot play the item from your hoard. Choose a race for which the item gives a bonus: while you control this item, each of opponent’s characters in play of given race has its CC modified by -1 (-2 for minions) and receives +1 prowess against Dragons. CvCC at your Dragon’s Den [K] cannot be cancelled. Invert this card when the item comes into active play again: it is worth 3 mp to any player controlling the item (even a hero or Fallen-wizard player).Cannot be duplicated on a given item and for a given race.

card.name: Fire and Water
card.text: Unique. Playable during the site phase at a Border-hold [B]. The site must be in the same or an adjacent region as where aDragon faction is in play. Tap a character in the company to make an influence attempt against the Dragon faction, modified by +3 for every creature playable at the site you discard from hand or play (place in opponent’s mp if the Dragon faction is in play by opponent). If successful, place the faction in the out of play pile and this card in your mp. All versions of the site become Ruins & Lairs [R]. Otherwise you face an attack by the Dragon faction (cannot be cancelled, regardless of other card effects; remove this card from the game after the attack). Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Fire-storm
card.text: Fire-dragon only. Playable on a Fire-dragon facing an attack. +4 to the Dragon’s prowess, -2 to the body of any strike he faces. Alternatively, playable on a Fire-dragon during CvCC, before strikes are assigned. Each opposing character must make a body check modified by –1 for each armor, helmet and/or shield item he bears (only 1 item of the same type). If he fails this body check the character becomes wounded.Cannot be duplicated on a given attack or CvCC.

card.name: Fram Wyrmslayer
card.text: Unique. Grey Agent. Manifestation of Fram Framson. +3 prowess against Dragons and Drakes. May not be among the starting characters and may only be brought into play at his home site. Agent only: tap: if at a site where an opponent’s Dragon faction is in play to face the associated Dragon attack. +1 to any resulting body checks after the attack. If the attack is defeated place the faction in the out of play pile.

card.name: Frightful Guardian
card.text: Playable on a site. Until the end of the turn, the company must face all of the site’s automatic attacks each time an item is played at the site; these attacks receive +1 prowess per item played at the site this turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Gloaming Golden Hoard
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a Dragon’s Den [K]. If you have stored at least 10 mp from hoard items (count 1 mp for each hoard minor item), your hand size is increased by 1. If you have stored at least 2 Ore resources, this card is worth 1 mp. Discard this card when the site leaves active play. Cannot be duplicated by a given player

card.name: Grashûkh
card.text: Unique. Uruk-hai. Leader. Discard on a body check of 8. +2 prowess against Dragons and Drakes. +2 EI against Orcs. Discard when in the company with a Dragon. tap: during the organization phase to allow his company to move through a mountain region (and not stop at a site therein).

card.name: Great Falcons of Mirkwood
card.text: Unique. Flying. Playable at Mountains of Mirkwood if the influence check is greater than 9. Standard Modifications: none. tap: cancel an attack by a non-unique creature keyed to a region of Mirkwood (by single region type) against any of your moving companies. Cannot be played by an overt company.

card.name: Great Northern Bear
card.text: Animal. Bear. 1 strike. +4 prowess against Dragon- characters. May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Dragon Gap, Grey Mountains, Grey Mountain Narrows, Gundabad, Heart of Mirkwood, Northern Rhovanion, Western Mirkwood, Withered Heath, and Woodland Realm; and may also be played non-Haven [H] sites in these regions. May not be played against a company containing a character with Beorn’s House as his home site. Cannot be duplicated on a given movement/hazard phase.

card.name: Great Ruin and Fire under Tree
card.graphics: Great Ruin and Fire under Tree.jpg
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase on a non- Dragon’s Den, non-Ruins & Lairs [R] site in a Wilderness [w] where your Dragon-lord is present. The company faces 3 attacks (no type) — 4 strikes with 9 prowess, 3 strikes with 11 prowess, 2 strikes with 13 prowess. Following these attacks, tap your Dragon-lord or discard this card. If not discarded, discard any factions in play at this site. Your opponents may not play any character or resource at this site. All versions of this site become a Ruins & Lairs [R]. Discard this card when the site is discarded or returned to its location deck. Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Great Strength
card.text: Dragon only. Dragon-magic. Target and cancel any effect (declared earlier in the same chain of effects) that would cancel CvCC involving a Dragon-character. This card may be played during your opponent’s turn. Cold-dragon only: lower the body of any strikes of an attack the Dragon faces by 1.

card.name: Greater Storms
card.text: Environment. Playable on a company using flying movement. Make a roll. If the result is less than 7, tap all characters and allies in the company. Otherwise, the company is not considered flying for the rest of the turn (change the site path accordingly; if the company cannot reach the new site, defender must choose a new within 2 regions of the original site of destination).

card.name: Grim Voiced and Grim Faced
card.text: Unique. Playable on Bard Bowman. +2 to his mind, prowess and body, +1 to his EI. Except when facing an attack or strike, Bard may tap to untap a Black Arrow he is bearing. This card may be played with a starting company in lieu of a minor item.

card.name: Grim-faced Northman
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. tap: during the site phase, if at one of his home sites, to take one character, ally or faction playable there from your discard pile or play deck (reshuffle) to your hand.

attr.value: Any site in Northern or Southern Rhovanion

card.name: Grimbeorn the Old
card.text: Unique. +2 prowess against Orcs. +2 EI against the Beornings faction. Counts as Beorn for the purpose of playing Skin-changer. Discard Grimbeorn if his controlling player has Bad Company in play.

card.name: Grimson the Fearless
card.text: Unique. His prowess is only modified by -1 when not tapping to face a strike. If you are a Dragon-lord, Grimson the Fearless may play allies normally playable only your Dragon-lord; he may control a maximum of 2 such allies. Your Dragon-lord may transfer any allies he controlls to Grimson during the organization phase.

attr.value: this site is considered a Haven [H] for the purposes of healing.
Men — each character faces a strike with 6 prowess (detainment against covert company).
characters in a covert company may heal at this site. Poison and Wose Shamanist Potion may be played from sideboard at this site.

card.name: Haeldwyn
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against Orc characters with a mind lower than his. If controlling a Stolen Knowledge card, he can use sorcery. If controlling a Lost Knowledge card, he can use spirit-magic.

card.name: Heladil
card.text: Unique. Silvan. +2 prowess against Spiders. +1 EI against the Wood-elves faction. Discard a Greenwood the Great from the company to heal Heladil.

card.name: Hide Pitted with Corruption
card.text: Dragon only. +3 to a Dragon’s body until the end of the turn. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Hollow by the Left Breast
card.text: Information. Stolen Knowledge. Ranger or scout only. Playable on a Dwarf, Elf, Hobbit or Man during the site phase at any Dragon’s Lair, or a Border-hold [B] in Northern Rhovanion. Tap the character and the site. When facing a Dragon in CvCC its body is halved (round up). Discard this card if a dark enchantment is played on the character or after a Dragon has been defeated by the company in CvCC. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Honey
card.text: Treasure. Food item. Playable at Beorn’s House or Ligr Wodaize Berne. This card is worth 2 mp to a grey or black player.

card.name: Horn of Defiance
card.text: Unique. Hoard item. Instrument. +2 EI. A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to “restore” it. Once restored, Horn of Defiance gives 3 mp and 2 CP. tap: if restored and if bearer is the first to face a strike of an attack, to face all strikes of the attack. The character faces a separate strike sequence for each strike.

card.name: Hunger
card.text: Hunting mode. Playable on a Dragon character. Target character must move every turn to a new site and must move through at least 2 Wilderness [Ww]. He cannot move to a site more than 4 regions away from any of his Dragon’s Dens [K] (6 regions if the Dragon is winged). If he is not at a Dragon’s Den during the organization phase, he must return to a Dragon’s Den. Additionally, hazard creature attacks against his company cannot be cancelled. Discard this card after the Dragon has defeated a hazard creature or eaten a character, ally or faction. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon.

card.name: Hunters and Slayers
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Prisoner. Playable on one of your companies during CvCC, before rolls are made. For each successful strike in CvCC the defeated character is not wounded, but placed ´´off to the side´´ with this card along with all non-follower cards he controls (discard any allies). Discard this card if no characters are placed with it after CvCC, or if the company size is ever lower than the number of characters placed with it. During your end-of-turn phase make a roll: if the result is less than 6, discard this card. If this card is discarded, any prisoners immediately form a company at the company’s current site or the site moved to. This card and all cards attached may be stored at a Dragon’s Den [K]. Any prisoner so stored is considered Gathered Bones and is eliminated.

card.name: Hunting
card.text: Hunting Mode. Playable during the organization phase on a Dragon character. Return this card to your hand: when you play anothermode card, or during your organization phase if you so choose. The Dragon receives -2 prowess, may not control characters, and may move to sites in the same or adjacent regions as one of his Dragon’s Dens [K] or his home site. At the beginning of their movement/hazard phase, if the Dragon is unwounded, you may choose for any company moving through the region containing the Dragon’s current site to face an attack by the Dragon (attacker chooses defending characters if the Dragon is winged): 2 strikes with the Dragon’s current prowess plus 7. If a strike fails, the Dragon is wounded (no body check is required).

card.name: Insatiable Hunger
card.text: Playable on a Dragon character. If during his untap phase target Dragon bears more mp from items (use the maximum mp as given on the card) than his current prowess, he must remove 1 item of his choice and place it in his out of play pile. Discard this card after a hazard creature played on the Dragon’s company was defeated.

card.name: Itangast the Guest-eater
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Itangast. Fire-dragon. May not move. +2 prowess against Men and Dwarves. +4 to his rolls for offering attempts. -3 to your influence attempts against manifestations of Ando-anca, Smaug, Scatha and Throkmaw. While Itangast is at Gold Hill, your Orcs and Trolls require one less influence to control. tap: during CvCC for an extra strike.

card.name: Jewel-healer
card.text: Playable on a non-warrior or sage Dwarf character at one of your Lord-havens [H] (or in your starting company). Bearer may tap to heal a character (from wounded to tapped) for every mp worth of jewel and/or ore items and events in the company (with a minimum of 1). Target Dwarf must make a CC, and each wounded character must make a body check modified by -2 (before being healed).

card.name: Kelvar Enraged
card.text: All attacks by Apes, Bears, Boars, Eagles andWhales receive +1 strike and -2 body. Each character wounded by such an attack must make an additional body check. Discard this card if such an attack is defeated.

card.name: Khuzadrepa
card.text: Unique. Cold-dragon. May be played at Thunder Cleft. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Forrhûn, Grey Mountains, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion, and Withered Heath; may also be played at sites in these regions. +2 prowess against Dwarves.

card.name: Khuzadrepa Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Forrhûn, Grey Mountains, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion and/or Withered Heath immediately faces a Cold-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 3 strikes at 13/8 (attacker chooses defending characters); +2 prowess against Dwarves. If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Dorwinion, Eorstan and Grey Mountain Narrows.

card.name: Khuzadrepa at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Khuzadrepa Ahunt is in play, Thunder Cleft has an additional automatic- attack: Cold-dragon — 2 strikes at 16/9. In addition, each Dwarf wounded by a strike from a Balrog, Dragon or Spawn must make a CC modified by -1, after the body roll was made.

card.name: Khuzadrepa Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Khuzadrepa. Playable at Thunder Cleft if the influence check is greater than 14. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+6); if a manifestation of Agburanar or Itangast is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Khuzadrepa against any of your companies are cancelled. Any company moving in Forrhûn, Grey Mountains, Iron Hills, Northern Rhovanion and/or Withered Heath faces an attack: Cold-dragon — 2 strikes at 15/9 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters); +2 prowess against Dwarves.

card.name: Kine of Araw
card.text: Animals. Each character in the company faces a strike. May be played keyed to Dorwinion, Forrhûn, Harrhûn, Horse Plains and Southern Rhovanion; and also at Ruins & Lairs [R] in these regions. +2 prowess if the company has already faced Kine of Araw this turn. A character with a home site in any of the above regions may tap to cancel an attack by Kine of Araw against his company.

card.name: King of Dale
card.text: Unique. Playable on Bard Bowman, Bain or Brand,if you have at least 3 unique hero factions in play at sites in Northern Rhovanion or its adjacent regions and you have defeated a unique Dragon manifestation with a home site in one of these regions. +3 to bearer’s EI. Factions playable at sites in these regions are worth +1 mp to you. Automatic- attacks at any site in Northern Rhovanion attack normally (not as detainment) and with +2 prowess against minion companies.

card.name: Knowledge of Their Making
card.text: Grey player only. Stolen Knowledge. Playable on an avatar or character with a mind greater than 7 at Isengard or any site with a Nazgûl automatic-attack. Tap the character and the site. +1 or -1 to all rolls for ring tests in the company (may be applied after the roll).Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Leucaruth the Wrathful
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Leucaruth. Female. Fire-dragon. +2 prowess against Dwarves and -2 to the body of Dwarf strikes. She may normally move one region. If an opponent’s company containing a Dwarf is at a site in Witherd Heath or adjacent regions she may move to that site. She must always return to her home site the next turn.

card.name: Lomaw
card.text: Unique. Ice-dragon. May be played at Collarmount. 3 strikes. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Lhûgdalf, Talath Oiohelka and Talath Uichel; may also be played at sites in these regions (attacker chooses defending characters if keyed to a region).

card.name: Lomaw Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Lhûgdalf, Talath Oiohelka and/or Talath Uichel immediately faces an Ice-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 4 strikes at 12/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Azjan, Forrhûn, Grey Mountains and Withered Heath.

card.name: Lomaw at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Lomaw Ahunt is in play, Collarmount has an additional automatic- attack: Ice-dragon — 3 strikes at 15/8. In addition, all flattery, offering and riddling attempts by characters in Wilderland or the Northern Waste are modified by -2.

card.name: Lomaw Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Lomaw. Playable at Collarmount if the influence check is greater than 12. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+3) or a greater item (+5); if a manifestation of Agburanar, Gostir, or Itangast is in play (-4); +1 for every animal or wolf faction you have in play in the Northern Waste. All attacks by manifestations of Lomaw against any of your companies are cancelled. Any company moving in Barl Syrnac, Forovirkain, Lhûgdalf, Talath Oiohelka, and/or Talath Uichel faces an attack: Ice-dragon — 3 strikes at 14/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters).

card.name: Lomaw the Old
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Lomaw. Ice-dragon. May not move. Can use spirit-magic. +2 to his rolls for riddlingand offering attempts. -3 to your influence attempts against manifestations of Agburanar, Gostir and Itangast. If an opponent’s company is moving through a region in the Northern Waste, you may look at a number of cards from opponent’s hand equal to half the number of Wilderness [w] in the site path (round up). tap: during CvCC for an extra strike.

card.name: Long Forgotten Gold
card.text: Playable during the site phase on a company at a minion Dwarf-hold. Until the end of the turn hoard items are playable at the site. Additionally the first treasure item played at this site this turn does not tap the site. Alternatively, playable on a company at a minion Elf-hold: any gold ring item is playable at the site until the end of the turn.

attr.value: Items (minor major, greater*) *—battle gear items only—
Ancient Dwarf-ruin. Vein of Arda may be played on a Dwarf at this site (as if at an Under-deeps site).
Items (minor major, greater*) *—battle gear items only—

card.name: Lulled by His Words
card.text: Flattery attempt. Playable during the site phase ona character attempting to influence an opponent’s non-avatar character (as listed below). Make a roll (instead of the normal influence attempt), modified by +2 if the character is a diplomat and +2 if a Dragon. If the result is greater than the listed values, the character is automatically influenced away. Against Men, Orcs, or Trolls 10; against Dwarves and Hobbits 11; against Dúnedain, Elves and Woses 12.

card.name: Made His Dwelling There
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a non- Dragon’s lair Ruins & Lairs [R] in a Wilderness [w], Border-land [b] or Shadow- land [s], if your Dragon-lord is there. The site becomes one of your Dragon’s Dens [K] (place a copy of Dragon’s Den with the site). If your Dragon-lord is at this site, replace the automatic-attacks for all other versions of this site with that of your Dragon-lord’s home site.

card.name: Make Use of His Desire
card.text: Offering attempt. Playable during opponent’s site phase on a diplomat when CvCC i ap is declared. Target diplomat makes a CC. If he does not fail, discard an item from his company (as listed below) and make a roll adding his unused EI. If the result is greater than the listed values, the attack is cancelled and you may take one resource from your play deck (reshuffle) or discard pile to your hand. Greater item/5, major item/6, gold ring item/7, minor item/8.

card.name: Marauding Fire
card.text: Fire-dragon only. Playable on a Fire-dragon facing a creature attack, before strikes are assigned. Make a roll and add the Dragon’s prowess. If the result is higher than the attack’s prowess, all of the attack’s strikes fail; make a body check to see if the creature is defeated, the creature gains +1 body for every strike of the attack. If the creature is not defeated, the attack proceeds normally.

attr.value: Port on Anduin. Agents attack with +2 prowess at this site.
Men — 2 strikes with 6 prowess (detainment against covert companies)
Port on Anduin. Grey agents attack with +2 prowess at this site.

card.name: Mating Duel
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on an untapped Dragon-lord, if his company faces an attack by a unique Dragon manifestation of the opposite sex. Tap your Dragon-lord; the attack is cancelled. You may rotate Mating Duel by 90° to cancel an attack by any manifestation of this Dragon against your Dragon-lord’s company or convert the attack to detainment against any other of your companies. Discard Mating Duel when it is rotated 360°. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Memories of Ancalagon
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Any character at the same site as your Dragon- lord (or a site in the same region if your Dragon-lord is winged) must make a CC modified by -1. Alternatively, play to heal your Dragon- lord (from wounded to tapped).

card.name: Memories of Glaurung
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Place this card on your Dragon-lord if he is in play. He may use spirit-magic and all spirit-magic cards are also considered Dragon-magic cards for you.

card.name: Men of the Wood
card.text: Men. Each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). May be played keyed to Anduin Vales, Heart of Mirkwood and Western Mirkwood; and may also be played keyed to non-Haven [H] sites in these regions. May also be played on Woodmen-town or Mathlaburg, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard Men of the Wood at the end of the site phase). May not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with Woodmen-town as a home site.

attr.value: men. each character in the company faces a strike (detainment against covert and hero companies). may be played keyed to anduin vales, heart of mirkwood and western mirkwood; and may also be played keyed to non-haven [h] sites in these regions. may also be played on woodmen-town or mathlaburg, creating an additional automatic-attack (discard men of the wood at the end of the site phase). may not be played against a covert or hero company containing a character with woodmen-town as a home site.
Rescue Prisoners may be played at this site (as if at a Shadow-hold [S]).
No Better Use may be stored at this site instead of at Shelob's Lair.

card.name: My Breath Death
card.text: Only playable on a character facing a strike from Dragon´s Breath. +2 to the prowess of the strike.If target character becomes wounded but is not eliminated, he must remove one item he carries from the game (defender’s choice); if he is eliminated, two items must be removed instead (if available, defender’s choice).

card.name: No Match in Your Treasuries
card.text: Playable on a unique stored item. This item gives no mp. All opponents’ item mp totals are reduced by the amount of mp this item would normally give. If target item is not a treasure item, this card only affects opponents of the same alignment.

card.name: No Weapon Seemed to Bite Him
card.graphics: No Weapon Seemed to Bite Him.jpg
card.text: Dragon only. Playable on a Dragon character facing a strike from a Dúnadan, Dwarf, Elf, Man or Orc attack (or during CvCC). +1 to his prowess and +2 to his body. Additionally, weapons do not modify the prowess of characters assigning/assigned a strike to/from the Dragon character.Cannot be duplicated for a given attack.

attr.value: Ancient Dwarf-ruin. This site is considered a Dwarf-hold for the purpose of playing Long Forgotten Gold.

card.name: Oath to the Dragon
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a character inyour Dragon-lord’s company (or in your starting company). The character: becomes a leader (if not already), receives +1 to his CC and cannot be discarded by a body check. Additionally the character can only be controlled by your Dragon-lord or GI, and no rolls are required to keep the character in play. All influence attempts against this character are modified by -3. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Of the Race of Dale
card.text: Playable on Bard Bowman, Bain or Brand. When bearinga Black Arrow and assigned a strike from a Dragon orDrake attack, tap Black Arrow to give a -3 modification to the attack’s prowess and body (instead of its normal modification). Discard this card if there is more than 1 Black Arrow in the company.

card.name: Old and Cunning
card.text: Dragon only. Dragon-magic. Playable on an untapped Dragon character. Tap the Dragon and you may take one resource from your sideboard to your hand. Next time the Dragon would untap, discard this card instead.

card.name: Old Winyards
card.text: Playable at any tapped or untapped Border-hold [B]. Discard Old Winyards during the site phase at a Free- hold [F] to make 1 minor item playable at the site. You may play a major item instead if you discard 2 copies of Old Winyards, or a non-hoard greater item if you discard 3 copies.

card.name: Orc of the Claw
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Discard on a body checkresult of 7. -3 to his influence attempts.

card.name: Orcs of His Dominion
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon-lord, if at an Orc-hold where you have an Orc faction in play. Any Orc-hold where you have an Orc faction in play is considered one of your Dragon’s Dens (place a Dragon’s Den copy on it). If at such a site, your Dragon-lord may tap to give all your Orc characters +1 prowess and +1 body until the end of the turn, and any non-unique Orc creature may be played against all opponents’ companies keyed to the region containing this site.Discard this card if you have no Orc faction in play at an Orc-hold. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Orcs of the Claw
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable by your Dragon-lord at a Dragon’s Den [K], if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: Each Orc faction in play in the same or an adjacent region (-2). This faction is worth 1 extra mp for any other Orc faction you have in play at a site in the same region or an adjacent region (to a maximum of 4 mp). Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Pierced with Enchantment
card.text: Dragon only. Dragon-magic. Playable on a Dragon character during CvCC, before strikes are assigned. Choose a non-avatar, non-ringwraith, non-undead, non-maia character in opponent’s company. Make a roll: if the result is greater than the character’s mind +2, the character is treated as if being in the Dragon character’s company during CvCC. The character does not leave his company. Cannot be duplicated on a given attack.

card.name: Resistance of Will
card.text: Playable during your opponent’s site phase,if your opponent makes an influence attempt against one of your characters. Based on that character’s normal mind, you may modify opponent’s roll by the following:1-4 mind: -2; 5-7 mind: -3; 8+ mind: -4. Alternatively, play to cancel any offering or flattering attempt against one of your characters.

card.name: Riches Gathered
card.text: Playable on a Dragon-lord. At the end of his organisation phase the Dragon-lord must attack a number of characters in his company bearing an item, based on his P: less than 3 P: no characters; 3-5 P: 1 character; 6-8 P: 2 characters; more than 8 P: 3 characters. These attacks cannot be cancelled. Discard this card when any opponent plays an item stored at the Dragon-lord’s home site.

card.name: Ringil
card.text: Unique. Hoard item. Weapon. +1 to body.Warrior only: +1 to prowess (to a maximum of 8).A stored Reforging may be placed with this item to “restore” it. Once restored, Ringil gives 4 mp, 3 CP and +5 to prowess (to a maximum of 11).

card.name: Rivermen of the Anduin Vales
card.text: Unique. Playable at Mathlaburg if the influence check is greater than 7Standard Modifications: character with home site in Anduin Vales or Western Mirkwood (+2). tap: reveal the top 5 cards of your play deck and take one ring item to your hand (shuffle rest back into the deck).

card.name: Roaming
card.text: Roaming mode. Playable on a Dragon character at his home site or any Dragon’s Den [K]. Return this card to your hand: when you play another mode card, or during your organization phase if you so choose.–2 to the Dragon’s prowess and he may move with region-movement, to a maximum of 2 regions (in all cases).

card.name: Scales and Jewels
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon- lord if he bears a treasure or jewel item worth at least 2 mp. Place the item in your out of play pile. +2 to his body (to a maximum of 11).

card.name: Scatha the Worm
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Scatha. Cold-dragon. May not move. +2 prowess against Dragons, Drakes, Elves and Dwarves. While Scatha is at Gondmaeglom your influence attempts are modified by +1. -3 to your influence attempts against manifestations of Ando-anca, Itangast, Smaug and Throkmaw. tap: when at Gondmaeglom to bring a resource short- event that can be played on a Dragon character from your discard pile to your play deck (reshuffle). tap: during CvCC for an extra strike.

attr.value: A company at or moving to this site may play Ready to His Will on an Orc or Troll attack with normally one strike (as printed on the card); it may also be played from sideboard.

card.name: Share of the Treasure
card.text: Hoard item. Treasure. Discard to cancel a detainment attack by Orcs, Dwarves, Dúnedain or Men against the bearer’s company. You may include up to 14 copies of Share of the Treasure in your play deck and sideboard combined. Values in parenthesis apply to a minion bearer.

card.name: Shoot in the Eye
card.text: Information. Warrior only. Playable on a Dwarf, Orc, orMan warrior during the site phase at at The Wind Throneor any Dragon’s Lair. Tap the character and the site. When facing a Dragon in CvCC its body is halved (round up). Discard this card after a Dragon has been defeated by the company in CvCC, or if a dark enchanment is played on target character. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Sign of Might
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon- lord if he bears The One Ring. Make a roll adding 1 for each sage in his company and each Sign of Might in play. If the result is: less than 8, your Dragon-lord is eliminated; 8-10, discard this card; 10-12, you gain 2 mp and The One Ring affects your Dragon-lord; greater than 12, you win the game. Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Smaug the Golden
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Smaug. Winged. Fire-dragon. May not move. +4 to his riddling rolls -3 to your influence attempts against manifestations of Ando-anca, Itangast or Scatha.

card.name: Spell-bound
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playable on your Dragon-lord. Each of opponent’s companies movingthrough the region containing your Dragon-lord’s current site must make a roll, modified by +2 for each sage, +1 for each scout or diplomat, and by -2 if your Dragon-lord is in dream mode. If the result is 10 or less, your opponent must replace the company’s new site with his version of your Dragon-lord’s current site (if available); the company may do nothing during the site phase. Discard this card afterwards.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Spoilation
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase if your Dragon-lord is at a non-Ruins & Lairs [R] site. If your Dragon-lord successfully plays an item this turn, he is not tapped and may face all of the site’s automatic-attacks again to play another item. He may do this as often as he likes, but receives -3 to his prowess for every additional automatic-attack faced.Cannot be duplicated on a given turn.

card.name: Stalk the Halls
card.text: Roaming mode. Playable on a Dragon during the organization phase. Return this card to your hand: when you play another mode card, or during your organization phase if you so choose. The Dragon may move using Under-deeps movement. +1 to his rolls required to move between adjacent Under-deeps sites. Additionally, -2 to his prowess if his current site’s surface site is not a Dragon’s Den [K] (or Darkhaven), and his prowess is modified by -3 when not tapping to face a strike.

attr.value: Undead. Dragon — 1 strike with 16 prowess —neither attack nor strikes can be cancelled or made ineffectual—

When this site is revealed opponent may search his discard pile for a hazard which must be placed on-guard. If this card is not revealed it return to the discard pile after the site phase. Any item worth more than 3 mp playable at non-specific sites may also be played at this site.
Undead. Dragon — 1 strike with 16 prowess —neither attack nor strikes can be cancelled or made ineffectual—

When this site is revealed opponent may search his discard pile for a card which must be placed on-guard. If this card is not revealed it returns to the discard pile afterthe site phase. Any item worth more than 3 mp playable at non-specific sites may also be played at this site.

card.name: Talmog
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Leader. +3 EI against Orcs. Discard on a body check result of 8.

card.name: Targeted for the Hunt
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the organization phase on your Dragon-lord, if not at a Dragon’s Den [K]. Name a hazard creature that can be keyed to the site or the region containing the site (ignore multiple region symbols). If the hazard player has such a creature in hand, it immediately attacks the Dragon-lord as though he were a one character company. Otherwise he must show his hand.

card.name: Territorial Disputes
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on your Dragon-lord, if at his home site.His company may move with region movement to and from any Dragon’sLair corresponding to a Dragon hazard -or resource manifestation in play (resulting in legal movement). Attacks of this Dragon manifestation against his company cannot be cancelled. If your Dragon-lord is at such Lair, he faces an attack at the beginning of the site phase: the duplicate of the site’s first automatic-attack, modified by +1 to prowess and strikes. Immediately after this attack, tap your Dragon-lord or discard this card. If not discarded, make a roll to play an item based on the result: 2-3: minor item; 2-6: gold ring item; 7-9: major item; 10-12: greater item; any result: special item playable at the site. This item may also be played from your discard pile. If successfully played, place this card in your mpp.

card.name: Thane's Attire
card.text: Unique. Hoard item. Weapon. Shield. Helmet. Two-handed. Warrior only: +2 to prowess (to a maximum of 8), +2 to body (to a maximum of 10). Cannot be used by a Hobbit. tap: take one Block played on the bearer of this item to hand instead of discarding it. Invert this item (or place a token) instead of making a body check for the bearer. Discard a Reforging from the company to re-invert this item. Remove the item from game if inverted twice.

card.name: The Dragon's Disciple
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Can use spirit-magic. +2 EI against Men. Tap your Dragon-lord to play Wielder of Old Arts on The Dragon’s Diciple (if in the same company) as if he were a Dragon-lord.Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: The Master
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against any faction playable at Lake-town. -1 to all of his CC. tap: at any time, if at his home site, to cancel an attempt to bring a Man character into play at a site in Northern Rhovanion.

card.name: Thralls
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable at a tapped or untapped non-Dragon’s Den [K] site in same region as one of your Dragon’s Dens if the influence check is greater than 8. tap: during the end-of-turn phase to allow characters to store items at the site where this faction was played (these items are considered stored at your nearest Dragon’s Den). Cannot be duplicated at a given site.

card.name: Throkmaw
card.text: Unique. Fire-dragon. May be played at Shab Arch. 3 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may also be played keyed to Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Talath Oiohelka and Talath Uichel and to sites in these regions.

card.name: Throkmaw Ahunt
card.text: Unique. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Talath Oiohelka and/or Talath Uichel immediately faces a Fire-dragon attack (considered a hazard creature attack) — 4 strikes at 13/7 (attacker chooses defending characters). If Doors of Night is in play, this attack also affects: Lhûgdalf, Everdalf, Lindalf and Withered Heath.

card.name: Throkmaw at Home
card.text: Unique. Unless Throkmaw Ahunt is in play, Shab Arch has an additional automatic- attack: Fire-dragon — 2 strikes at 16/8. In addition, each Orc hazard creature played keyed to a region or at a site in the Northern Waste receives +1 prowess and strikes.

card.name: Throkmaw Roused
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Throkmaw. Playable at Shab Arch if the influence check is greater than 14. Modifications: influencer discards a major item (+2) or a greater item (+7); if a manifestation of Angurth, Itangast, Scatha or Smaug is in play (-3). All attacks by manifestations of Throkmaw against any of your companies are cancelled. Any company moving in Dragon Gap, Forovirkain, Grey Mountains, Talath Oiohelka and/or Talath Uichel faces an attack: Fire-dragon — 3 strikes at 15/8 prowess/body (attacker chooses defending characters).

card.name: Throkmaw the Vain
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Throkmaw. Winged. Fire- dragon. May not move. +1 to all body checks resulting from failed strikes he taps to face. -3 to your influence attempts against manifestations of Angurth, Itangast, Scatha or Smaug. tap: if at a Dragon’s Den to give +1 prowess and body to all Orcs in any of your companies until the end of the turn. tap: during CvCC for an extra strike.

attr.value: Dragon — 1 strike with 13 prowess (attacker chooses defending character)
Ancient Dwarf-ruin. Durang may be played on a Dwarf at this site (as if at an Under-deeps site).
Dragon — 1 strike with 13 prowess (attacker chooses defending character)
Ancient Dwarf-ruin. Durang may be played on a Dwarf or Orc at this site(as if at an Under-deeps site).

card.name: Too Narrow a Hole
card.text: Playable on a non-Dwarf, non-Hobbit, non-Orc or non-Umli character. -1 to all his rolls (-2 if a Olog- hai Troll or Dragon character) while at a Dungeon or an Under-deeps site. Additionally, -3 to a Dragon characters Under-deeps movement rolls. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

attr.value: Contains a hoard. Wild Fell Beast may be played at this site.Any company at this site has its hazard limit increased by 1 for every unique Dragon manifestation in play.
Contains a hoard. Wild Fell Beast may be played at this site. Any company at this site has its hazard limit increased by 1 for every unique Dragon manifestation in play.

card.name: Treason the Chiefs
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Diplomat only. Playable on your diplomat Dragon-lord, if making an influence attempt against an opponent’s Man faction at a Border-hold [B]. Treat the influence attempt against the faction as if you revealed the faction from hand. If successful, put the faction in your mp; it is considered Gathered Bones.

card.name: Ulred
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against Rivermen of the Anduin Vales faction. Bridge may be played on his company moving to Mathlaburg, as if moving to a Haven [H]. tap: if at a Port-on-river site to bring one Down the Hurrying Waters from your discard pile to your play deck (reshuffle).

card.name: Under His Spell
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playableon your Dragon-lord. He may tap to play Memories Stolen on a character he faces in CvCC; Memories Stolen may also be taken from your sideboard or discard pile.

card.name: Unquenchable Flames
card.text: Any factions played at sites at which a company successfully plays Burning Rick, Cot and Tree or Smoke on the Wind, are returned to their owner’s hand.

card.name: Uruial
card.text: Unique. Dragon. Undead. Playable at Steel Fall. 2 strikes. Attacker chooses defending characters. If Doors of Night is in play, may be keyed at any Dragon’s lair if the associated Dragon was eliminated or is in play but not at the site. Any character wounded by a strike of this creature must make a CC modified by -2.

card.name: Veil Removed
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Dragon-magic. Playableon your Dragon-lord’s company during the movement/hazard phase. Discard one hazard permanent-event played on the company or an associated entity.

card.name: Wealth of His Halls
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable on a Dragon’s Den [K]. You may play one non-unique non-special item the site; this does not tap the site and may be done at a tapped site. Place this card with the item, it gives 0 mp at all times. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Western Winds
card.text: Any overt minion company moving to a Free-hold [F] site in Lindon, Anfalas, Belfalas, Lebennin, Anórien, Rohan, Fangorn, Wold & Foothills, or any region of Eriador the following regions must immediately return to its site of origin.

card.name: Whispering Voices
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Playable during the site phase on a company without a Dragon. Instead of making a normal influence attempt to bring a character into play, you may make a roll, modified by your Dragon-lord’s unused EI if he taps. If the result is greater than the character’s mind plus 1, he joins the company (otherwise discard the character).

card.name: Whispers of Wealth
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Greed mode. Playable during the organization phase on your Dragon-lord at a Dragon’sDen [K]. Return this card to your hand: when you play another mode card, or during your organization phase if you so choose. When an opponent’s company plays an item at a site within 4 regions away from your current Dragon’s Den (6 regions for a winged Dragon) you may discard this card to relocate your Dragon-lord to that site. Your Dragon-lord must engage in CvCC and 1 strike must target the character that has played the highest mp item this turn.

card.name: Wide Awake
card.text: Dragonlord specific. Place this card on your Dragon- lord if he is in play. If moving to a non-Dragon’s Den [K], non-Ruins & Lairs [R] site, you draw 2 more cards than normal for his company (to a maximum of 3). Discard this card if your Dragon-lord is in dream mode. Alternatively, discard this card at the end of your organization phase or during your opponent’s site phase to untap your Dragon-lord. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Wielder of Old Arts
card.text: Dragon-lord specific. Place this card on your Dragon-lord if he is in play. Your Dragon- lord may tap during your end-of-turn phase to take one Dragon-magic card from your discard pile to your hand. Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Wielder's Curse
card.text: Dark enchantment. Playable on a weapon. After facing a strike bearer must make a CC, modified by -1 if a Man orDwarf and -2 if the weapon gives a bonus or ability to a race other than bearer’s race. Any normal result of a failed CC is cancelled but defender must choose to wound either the bearer or a character in his company designated by the hazard player. Cannot be duplicated on a given weapon.

card.name: Wings under Trees
card.text: Playable on a company moving with flying movement, to a site in Mirkwood or with only Wilderness [w] in its site path. The prowess of each character and ally is modified by -3 (to a minimum of 6) this turn. If the company consists only of Dragon characters it is not considered flying this turn.

card.name: Wyrm's Blood
card.text: Dragon only. Playable on a Dragon character. Discard this card (at any time) after a successful strike against the Dragon: the strike is also considered failed (make any body checks to see if the strike is defeated). Additionally, if the Dragon is wounded, every non-Dragon creature played against his company costs 2 against the hazard limit. Cannot be duplicated on a given Dragon.

card.name: Wyrm's Reek
card.text: Cold-dragon only. Playable on a Dragon if CvCC is declared, before resolving the attack. You may play one Animal, Wolf or Spider hazard creature (as a creature) without asterix (*) on opponent’s company before or after resolving CvCC; the creature must be keyable to the Dragon’s current site, or to the region containing the site. This card may also be played during your opponent’s turn.
